I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

A hesitant recommendation. 

Pros: 
1. I played in VR for about 10hrs, then I went and picked up a u-haul trail irl. It was the first time in 15-20 years since I had driven a truck and trailer back on the farm. On my first attempt, I backed up the u-haul trailer at a right-angle into my driveway which is on a slight incline, and continued into my garage with only about 2-4 inches of side clearance from the trailer's wheel wells. This was all in one go. I thank ETS2 for that.

2. Get to drive a big rig.

3. Truck comes with a radio for some country hits and 80s power ballads.

Cons:
1. Just like riding and driving a semi irl, it isn't always the most fun thing to putz around and do. The whole gig is romanticized.  I grew up  with a couple trucker's in my life, and it seemed cool as a kid until I took a couple trips.

2. The cities in the game suck. No semblance of care has been put into making any of these cities look like there local. The cities all look the same. A handful of roads, some warehouses, some motel signs.... yeah, that's it. Heck, there's not even a trickle of water in Venice, Italy. No toll to drive the unloading dock outside the city. Nothing. Just same old, same old as every other city.

3. 50% of the time there is a wreck on the final exit ramp for your delivery, and if you decide to drive around you are looking at another 10-15mins of "real-life driving" and 2-5 extra hours of in-game driving. So yeah, just squeeze thru the barricade.

4. Can't stop at the Gas Stations for Road Dogs ...you know hot dogs on the road.

5. Can't stop at Truck Stops for Road Head ...you know head on the ....nvm. inappropriate.

6. If you want more Cons, just hit up the Negative Reviews there's loads of complaints about how shallow the game is under the hood.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

A couple trips in and I'm actual surprised how easy this game was to get used to (in third person at first but now first person as well).  It was a little intimidating at first but after following the tutorial and watching a couple YouTube videos, I'm very happy with how I'm able to pick up this game quickly; and I'm playing with a keyboard and mouse.  Definitely worth the money (and I'd recommend picking up the 'Map Pack' bundle to expand you're map selection to start).  Lots of fun to be had here, great game play, and beautiful scenery.

Just kick back, drive and listen to the massive selection of in-game internet radio stations.  I'm not saying I'd enjoy being a IRL trucker in the EU, but this game is even more enjoyable than I was anticipating.  Well worth it.

Ingredients For Lean Making:
If you are looking forward how to make lean, below is the list of all the things that are a prerequisite for preparing this drink:

Promethazine
Codeine
Prescribed cough syrup, the primary ingredient
Sprite
Styrofoam cup
Jolly rancher candies (optional)
Styrofoam cup
Jolly rancher candies (optional)
Guidelines On How To Prepare Lean:
Pour a bottle of sprite in your styrofoam cup. You can buy this cup from any liquid store.
Next to that, add the syrup in the cup and mix it in and out.
You can add few Jolly Ranchers which can bring some additional taste in the drink. Shake it in thoroughly.
You can add the volume of syrup and sprite in accordance with your choice.
Though sprite confers a classic taste to the drink, you can also try cherry soda or Mountain Dew for a change.
The cough syrup, you should be using must contain promethazine. Promethazine contributes to being the right and active ingredient and you cannot prepare lean without the use of it.

Don‚Äôt consume the drink in overdosage. Take in small quantity to enjoy it.

The drink makes you slow. So you should refrain from driving or any such work that needs more focus and concentration.

OK so ive been playing this game for 5 years straight and oh buy what a ride it has been. Its a decent truck sim that has been kept alive for 10 years straight at this point not only by the game devs making the game, but the absolutely insane mod support this game has. The sheer amount of mods available for this game is impressive to say the least, only helped by the fact that SCS themselves know that without mod support this game would have already died 5 years ago. So the tools to add content to this game are easily obtainable. Overall its one of the games that I bought that I really don't regret paying for as it payed off immensely with the endless amount of content being added to the game by both SCS and the modding community.
it is fun roaming in europ with modifieble[sorry if i have poor english] trucks attaching and detaching and many more things

What i have to say about this game is that it's a very good game for people that enjoy driving but don't want to get out of their house, and also for people that enjoy slow pace simulator games. So far i like the game, i play it on keyboard and mouse and it's not bad like people think it is, sometimes it's even better to play on keyboard and mouse than a low budget wheel. I do not recommend cheating cuz it defeats the purpose of the game, because if you don't need money you will not drive, and free roaming around europe is fun but still their are countless other games meant for JUST driving, and one more thing about having ‚àû money is that traffic rules lose their point and punishment mean nothing.

That's all from me, overall this game is very good if or if not you have a wheel.

This game is a masterpiece it's two simulators in one: a driving simulator and a consequence simulator.

You decided to get behind the wheel of wagon to deliver 20 tonne of concrete across Germany after 10 pints? Well you'll wake up finding your career ruined after you drunkenly ploughed down the autobahn the wrong way, at 100mph writing yourself and many unfortunate souls off in the process has consequences: you bank is empty and your staff have fucked off because there is no money to pay them. 

Texting at 100mph while going south bound on the M5 to get to London? Daft sod, you've just caused a 20 car collision and now your trucks in Calais. 

You thought that car would wait at that junction considering it's been sat there for 10 seconds while you approached and are now basically in-front of them? Nah mate, it's just like real like and the silly cunts gonna drive himself right under your wheels.

When this game first came out, anyone who grew up with PC gaming in the late 90's/early 2000's, would look at this game and expect to find it, in the ¬£4.99 wired basket bins in PC World. It was the sort of game, that was a throwaway game, you'd only pick up, if you absolutely loved the genre and you'd expect a couple of hours play from it.

However, over the years SCS has developed it to a point, where it is so much more that that.

Graphically, yes it looks good, but not stunning. AI Cars/Trucks, can still move strangely, let's say and of course just despawn, which is common in games like this.  

Game play wise, it can be grindy, pick up a cargo, drop it off and rinse repeat. After a while though you get enough money for your own truck and start to build your business.

Yes it can still be grindy from this point, but if you are into your trucks, you want to collect them and upgrade and customise them.

For the rest of us, who like driving games, it can be a nice relaxing game to pick up and play for a couple of hours now and then.

Listen, you drive a truck.  You follow the speed limit and wait for stop lights.  Sometimes you have a detour, sometimes there is traffic, sometimes it rains.  This is a game that is very basic up front, and once you have a couple of large garages filled with employees, you'll struggle to find something to do.  Thankfully, that should take at least 50 hours, at which point I think it's fair to say you got your money's worth.

On the plus side, there is a free mod called ProMods that adds A TON of new places and roads, among other things.  So it's nice to have that, but again, once you do a couple of 3,000km trips, you'll probably be wondering what exactly you're doing.

That said, I do enjoy it even if I might only play 30 minutes at a time now.  Just when you want to chill for a bit before getting back into something engaging, whether that is another game or going outside.

[h1]I have lots of fun, cruising and doing jobs.[/h1]
The quality is very high, with just a few flaws here and there.
(+ = positive, - = negative)

+ great graphics, both beautiful and precise. supporting 4k
+ truck handling feels realistic
+ all major european trucks, plus adding new models for free
+ good customization options
+ steam controller support, powerful tool to have lots of control
+ the multi player community is fun and mostly friendly, but most of them race at top speed like crazy on their jobs, which is annoying. actually driving convoys is not fun like this
+ support for double trailers in corresponding regions (but only recognizing the start and end point, not the route. you can drive through regions there double trailers aren't allowed)
+ well compressed large world with lots of regional details. the length of the jobs is satisfying. the space is shortened and time accelerated outside of cities.
(my region is pretty close to the real thing, just the cities are generic)
if you tried the base game and enjoyed it, i recommend to invest in map dlcs, it adds lots of new high quality playground
+ regular updates, meaningful improvements, taking care of the community
+ sometimes cool events, like providing material for a new bridge and then have it build after reaching the necessary amount of goods or transporting christmas presents or vaccines
+ fair pricing, also for the dlcs. you have the chance to support the ongoing development, but it's not to pricy

- the default settings are not good, you have to put in work and learning time to get things right, but after you did it's working well.
- your custom steam controller setups, which you need to build to have good control, can break with updates, you have to do it all over again and this is a lot of work
- not enough info. about your truck and trips for instance. things like weight of a build is hard to find out
there are often no explanations about the technical details and terms of the trucking world and how the game works
- the AI traffic is okay, most of the time pretty clever, but too often indifferent unnatural reckless decisions resulting in accidents and other bothersome problems. they give way when they shouldn't and don't when they should. on top of that, the game always blames you for accidents. more demanding situations can't be solved by the AI. the AI's physics are too simple, driving on rails
- surprisingly the english satnav voices are very low quality, the rest is good.
- the satnav is often too late and unprecise, but routing is good
- the compressed world leads to several problems. 
sleeping times are scheduled too tight, 2 hours left is already complicated, hard to find a sleeping spot on your route in that time, but some kind of jobs are on very tight schedules
the allowed speed differences are often too heavy and too fast
- zones are too rigid. you can only sleep on rigid sleeping zones, which first let you sleep on spots where you are in the way and second don't let you sleep when you are positioned well enough.
same goes for parking trailers at your destination.
- some trailer parking spots are bothersome, blocked by objects
- with double trailers it's sometimes impossible not to get stuck, cause the spaces are too tight, this is bothersome
- company grounds and cities are too generic and not very appealing, the dlc cities are way better
- the UI is not very well designed. it doesn't look good and takes too much space and is difficult to use
[i]- most parts of the accessory dlcs are dead ugly trucker taste (in my opinion lol) but you can use some[/i]
- the finances are not well balanced. at the start your budget is pretty tight, but after you start your company, you end up having overflooding hundreds of millions. ideally i would like to have a motivating (but not frustrating) financial side later in the game too and fun things to do with your money, invest and manage your company.
- you can't see your company drivers on the road and can't do much with them
- there's no truck storage space, for the trucks you want to use privately, you have to use garage space
- there should be more animations of truck unloading, refueling, ferry trips, speeding, police checks and the likes
- the construction work is pretty nice, but the accidents on the road are pretty unrealistic.
- i don't know much about truck transmissions, but with automatic transmission, even with 100 tons of load, it uses only 6 gears of the 12 or 16 you could have.
- the simulation of air brakes is a major nuisance, cause if you are trailer parking for instance, you are 80% out of air pressure, but you can switch it off. i don't know about the realism of that or ways to solve that in reality
- when loading heavy weights, axle load is ignored. 
- a saveable setup would be nice to tackle different loads with a suitable setup, without having to rebuild every detail again.

alltogether, it's bothersome at some points, but i'm enjoying it a lot most of the time

VR! VR! VR!  Yes, it's "not supported", but still very good.  With a steering wheel and pedals I would highly recommend it.  Even without VR it is still a great game.

Purchased in 2013 and played it for 100+ hours with only a couple DLC, great with multi-monitor and head tracking.   Over the years, I have kept purchasing DLCs hoping to get back to playing the game, but just did not get around to it.  2022 and finally got a quest 2 VR headset, all I can say is that playing this in VR puts head tracking to shame and it was great with head tracking!

If you have VR, I would say this is a must have and I hope that SCS continues to support VR and maybe even put a little more effort into it in the future, really just needs some UI tweaks to make it a bit better.

All jokes aside, this is an incredible game. All you fellow Americans might be wondering, is it hard to drive truck in Europe if I've never been outside the States? No, my friend, this game will slowly acclimate you to the roadways of Europe. The routes are fairly simple at first and as you level up you'll get more and more complicated ones with cargo that's more valuable and possibly more fragile/dangerous to haul. 

This game is perfect for people who like chilling out to a video game or are looking to have at least one game that's chill for listening to music to, putting on a podcast, or whatever. It's fucking great. Yeah, you can do a lot of silly things too as you'll read from other review comments, but if you take this game seriously you'll also get something from it. Difficulty scales in a few different ways:

Complexity  of the route - How far, where to, how remote, night or day, weather, etc. This will go up as you level up.
Load - What you're carrying might be fragile or dangerous. As you level up, you'll be have the option to haul dangerous and destructible loads that worth more for successfully transporting to the finish line.
Realism - You can choose the level of realism you want in your driving experience ranging from automatic transmission that's simple and has an almost arcade-game feel to it or you could get yourself a wheel, pedals, and an H-shifter and drive like it like the real thing. There's options in between these two extremes, of course, but it's neat that they included that.

You can customize almost everything in this game: cab, trailer, garage; once you've got one of each you can start expanding your logistics empire to cover the entirety of Europe if you've got the business sense for it. 

And maybe you just wanna drive without worrying about being the next Logan Roy of trucking, ok, there's an option to pick up routes for other companies on a freelance-style arrangement where they supply the truck and you drive the thing from point A to B.

After a measly 64 hours playing Euro Truck Simulator, I can safely say that this game has changed my life, and has inspired me to achieve more and strive to reach greater heights. After my wife left me in 2020 with my two children and most of my money, I was consumed in a downward spiral of depression, and there were many moments I contemplated ending it all to escape the miserable rut that became my life. However, I persevered, and my suffering finally payed off when I downloaded Euro Truck Simulator. There isn't a game that even comes close to reaching Euro Truck Simulator in terms of quality, most likely because Euro Truck Simulator has transcended the definition of 'game' entirely. Euro Truck Simulator is more of an enlightening journey, and as I travelled across the roads of Russia (Shout out to Putin) , my life took on a new meaning. At last, I had the courage to tell my boss I was quitting my day job to pursue a life on the roads. I don't have a driver's license, nor do I live in East Europe, but Euro Truck Simulator has opened my eyes to a new path for my life to take, and I intend to follow it. My only regret since starting Euro Truck Simulator is not getting it sooner, and I urge everyone reading this to get Euro Truck Simulator as soon as possible and also to donate money to me so I can move to Romania and open my trucking business.

I am a retired long haul truck driver and trucking company owner. At first, I thought that "playing a trucking game" in my retirement would be silly, but I was wrong. It is a great game. I am totally amazed by the realism and the perfect logic of the game. But I must admit that I have a super computer with a super graphics card and so I run the game at Ultra graphics settings. I also have a top of the line Thrustmaster wheel and pedals set. But even on a basic computer, this is a great game because the developers did an amazingly great job. Plus it is not just a 'driving' simulation, you need to manage your trucking business so it is a management game too. The pleasure of driving through Europe's fascinating cities or America's vast expanses is only one of three major pleasures of the game. Secondly, it is the challenge of driving a big rig with a triple lowboy around tight spots and up winding mountain roads, not to mention tricky pick up and delivery yards! Thirdly, the management side is much fun too. I play both Euro Truck Simulator and American Truck Simulator. Yes, I definitely recommend it.

Many players have said it before, I don't have anything new to add. It is peaceful to play, can run on variety of hardware and kill time like nobody's business. This is an ideal half-game. Perfect for having something to do with your hands while watching a show, series or a stream. Gameplay is simple, straightforward, and rewarding. 

There is no early game, there's no endgame, there's just driving.  And what driving it is. ETS2 manages to capture both landscapes and cities in a beautiful and very recognizable way. Once you have employees, go out for the views and enjoy the driving.

Any full game, whould have a transition from driving your truck to managing your trucking imperium. But alas, this is a half-game. But it's very good at what it does.

The game play is awesome. From a US trucker with 17 years of experience, I've been every where in the "lower 48" of the US. Was looking for something different. Found it with this game. However I'm tired of seeing all this Russia stuff. You guys have gone all over Europe including East to Russia. But you skipped Ukraine. Why? Ukraine is a much better a prettier country than Russia. Not to mention they don't go around bullying other countries or invading other countries like Russia. Let's see a Ukraine expansion. Or are you guys anti Ukriane?

Been playing ETS2 for a few years now and I got to say it's really unlike any other game I've played.
If you buy this game, please go for the full package and buy the DLC's since it makes the game a lot more fun and complete.

A huge con for me though is the modelling in the cities in countries such as the UK, the Netherlands, Germany etc.. (The countries that are by default in the game). Cities in these countries could use a lot more work and modelling.

As disappointed as I am with the cities in these countries, I am excited about the cities in the DLCs. You can clearly tell they put a lot more effort into modelling these cities because they actually look like cities, and when you drive through them it actually feels like you're in a city and not in some village with 2 truckdealers, a petrol station and a garage.

I highly recommend ETS2 and if you decide to give it a try, I suggest using a decent steering wheel for the true experience. (Maybe a shifter too)

Great game for people who want to have a realistic trucking game! And this shows that graphics aren't everything! 9/10

This game really does keep getting better....

1. The new scenery is absolutely lovely and so well detailed that it really does look like a real place.
2. Vehicle customisation is fantastic with tons of cosmetic parts plus the usual engine upgrades etc.
3. Ability to hire extra drivers to expand your empire
4. Ability to purchase your own trailers
5. Proper multiplayer support with A.I. traffic and a neat convoy system to make meeting up and doing the same job really easy.
6. VR Support that actually works very well
7. Tons of mods so that you can tweak to you hearts content.

This game is really fun to play single player and on convoy, I would recommend new players to also install TruckersMP (TMP), It turns the game into a server so you can play with other people online. I have been playing the game for 230 Hours nearly now and I have enjoyed every second of it, weather it is with my friends, In TMP events or just my byself, I would 100% recommend this game to everyone, I got the game when it was on a ¬£3.50 sale and I got all of the map extensions on exterior websites that give the DLC's for a cheaper price. ProMods is even better although you need all map extensions except for Iberia to get it, It ads in more places such as Ireland and it also adds in new cities and more detail to current cities. Keep up and amazing work SCS, I am looking forward to "Heart of Russia"!!

Worth your money.

Now ... about this game. It puts a lovely spell on the driver, honesty I'm in a state of bliss and relaxation when I play this game. I personally have experience driving big rigs, heavy equipment, pulling, backing, loading trailers of all sorts and more.  This game captures a lot of that real world life and implements it very well. 

If you want to really immerse yourself in the most realistic aspect of ETS2 just go into the settings and be ready to see how much you can enable in your truck to truly grasp what a REAL LIFE trucker goes through in cab and while on the road. 

The keybinding in this game rival that of Squad and Escape From Tarkov, as in there are a lot of them and tons of options. I was happily surprised when I first saw this. It told me that the developers are not messing around here and cared to make this as real as possible for the driver who wants to get as close to the real thing as they can.

The in-game environment is very visceral and plants the player firmly in a reality of actually being in a real world situation, you can hear birds chirping, the weather and lighting, time of day, sounds from people, industry, trains and so on are all great. 

C'mon, you get real lighting, thunder and the sounds that go along with a big strike as it lights up the sky at night while the rain is rapping at the cab of your rig and windshield. 

I play this game at 2K and the graphics are anything but "trash" as you may have read in the ignorant reviews here. I have everything maxed and I love how they chose to make this game look. Nothing else to say here. Proof is in the pudding!

Customization of your truck is endless, yes, you are awarded more and more as you gain XP and can also buy more customization options in DLC form but you are not beholden just to how those look, you can tweak those designs to the moon and back and make them something totally different. So basically the mind is the only things stopping anyone from doing what they want with these provided designs for customizing your rig. 

Then you can start your own fleet, manage multiple garages and all that goes along with that in this game as well. Or, just work for yourself, whatever you chose, I bet you will enjoy yourself. The online/convoy mode is another part of the game this is a hoot and brings something fresh into the game if you want to switch is up, it's a blast! Getting on the CB and chatting with your fellow drivers. 

This is not a gripe, but really, the only thing about a trucker they missed here is the securing of a load, the pre-trip-check/walk around for a drive, packing/stowing tarps and the other the various other aspects of the life a trucker takes care of on the daily while out for a delivery or for the long haul. That all said, I LOVE this game .. so to all of you i say grab a gear, hammer down and make the roads all yours.

This game is really enjoyable and a stress-relieving game. One of the best simulator games for me along with the vast DLC (although you probably need to purchase all the DLC within discount so you won't burn ur hardworking money) and also the community (i'm not even kidding) :-)

Absolutely love this game - I mean, what's not to love? Nothing like a long drive with your favourite tunes cracked up.

You start as a low-skilled, truckless lorry jockey, forced to take work from established haulage companies. Slowly (or rapidly if you go to a bank) you amass the funds to buy your first rig and rent your first yard. Then the fun really begins. Contract perusing, truck pimping, skill upgrading, driver hiring... this is Eddie Stobart: The Game in all but name.

Spending 90 minutes ferrying a tank of propane from Sheffield to Prague could (should?) be tedious. The fact that it isn't is largely down to good-if-not-quite-OMSI-standard physics, and varied road layouts and scenery. Periods of smooth, almost soporific motorway motoring nestle between passages of edgier wheelwork. One minute you're cruising along contemplating the sunset over the central reservation, the next you're on a rain-lashed country road at night, waiting for the right moment to pass a painfully slow pantechnicon. Tiredness can't kill in ETS2, but it can leave you jack-knifed in a ditch, feeling awful with a substantial repair bill to pay.

The only time when the game itself loses concentration is when attempting to evoke certain regions and sounds. The further you get from central Europe the less convincing the landscapes become. No one seems to have told SCS's countryside crafters that rural Britain features long green things called hedges. Cities are often depicted with the shortest of visual shorthand ‚Äì a few warehouses, the odd landmark if you're lucky. Don't expect to see a favourite local roundabout, slip-road, or speed camera in this highly-recommended HGV-driver RPG.

Very few driving games offer a relaxing experience and exploration of some beautiful roads and scenery. This game does in spades. 

The gameplay is excellent and the truck physics are quite realistic. You can choose to do long journeys or short, or just drive around to your hearts content. You run a business to make sure you get steady cashflow, and at the same time can chose your locations where you want to set up garages.

Over the years this game hasnt changed much, but then again....it doesnt need to. A very relaxing drive from one end of Europe to another if you wish, hauling deliveries and making money along the way.

The interface is clean and not cluttred, you have loads of customisations for your truck and to top it off, you can add your own music on the "radio". 

A game that can keep you entertained for hours on end if driving is your kind of thing.

Strawberry Cheesecake French Toast

Ingredients:

4 Slices Bread
4 Eggs
1 Tablespoon Vanilla
1 Cup Milk
1 Tablespoon Cinnamon
4 oz. Warm Cream Cheese
2 Tablespoons Vanilla Extract
2 Tablespoons Lemon Juice
¬æ Cup Heavy Cream
1 ¬Ω Cups Strawberry, Diced, Divided
‚Öì Cup Sugar
Confectioners Sugar
Maple Syrup

Preparation:

1.Whisk eggs, cinnamon, vanilla and milk together in medium-large bowl to create egg wash.

2. In medium bowl mix cream cheese, vanilla, sugar, lemon juice and heavy cream (optional).

3. Take 2 slices of bread and spread mixture on both.

4. Press sliced strawberries on both slices & press together.

5. Dunk in egg wash.

6. Melt butter in a skillet on medium-low heat and cook bread for 2-3 minutes or until crumbs are crispy and bread is more solid.

7. Stack and garnish with strawberries and confectioners sugar. Add maple syrup to preference.

Euro Truck Simulator 2 is a very nice game.

Starting with graphics that were good at the time, it looks very photorealistic today.

The game offers a remarkable variety of tractors, whether Iveco or Scania, every type of person gets their money's worth here.

There are many different types of trailers, from a small container trailer to the giant of the road: the triple trailer!

tuning options
The standard game already offers a tasty variety of tuning options, be it MAN (the new TGX is also coming!) or Volvo, but you can expand the brands Volvo, Scania, Mercedes and Daf with optional 'tuning DLCs'.

Half Atlas
The game features a large road network, do you want to drive in warm Turkey today and a week later hit the adventurous roads of southern Finland?
No problem!

Overall the game is a very enjoyable game, you don't need to own a steering wheel, there are mouse controls.

However, a steering wheel is highly recommended, I drive a Thrustmaster T300RS GT.

The only point I have to complain about is the articulated trains.
After so many years of standard tractors, articulated trains would be a most welcome update.

I can recommend the game, there is now an integrated multiplayer, alternatively you can choose the third party 'TruckersMP'.

I've been playing the game since 2016 CD version, since 2020 the Steam version.

So in general this game is great. It starts easy on you, no problems as long as you play in singleplayer.
But then you had to make the mistake to play this game online. With other people. People that probably never sat in a car. 
You want a heart attack? The other people in bigger citties got you! They drive like crazy. If you enter a city, there are no rules anymore. It's survival of the fittest.
You want your heart explode because of anger? The people on the highways or other streets in general got you! You drive where ever you want. You get fined for driving too fast? Don't worry, You get the Money back by ending your mission. You get fined for driving on the wrong side by accident? Don't worry, you will just be reported but still get your Money back.
But the other players have a different plan for you! They don't drive trucks, they drive bumper cars. And your Truck is their Target.
However, there ist one more enemy... Your own friends u play this game with. Because on a certain point of driving your truck throughout the emptiness of some cities, you let your guard down and that's the point where they strike, ejecting your truck into the unknown by pushing you off the road and then hitting you from a weird angle. 

So this game is funny, as long as you don't take it too serious :)

ETS 2 is a game that I have been playing since my childhood. I'm still having fun playing. I can say that this game is among the most relaxing games I have played. But there are some major shortcomings in the single player part of the game:

‚Ä¢ After playing the game for a few hours, it turns into a game of just taking a task and pressing the keyboard keys, and this is what discouraged me from playing the game all the time after a while.
‚Ä¢ I don't think the money earned from missions, tow truck prices, trailer prices, bank loan rates and the like are perfectly balanced.
‚Ä¢ The fact that it only rains in the game makes me think that the weather mechanics of the game are very poor. It would be more fun and challenging if it snowed, tornadoes or other natural disasters.

Highly recommend. It's a good in single player, and multiplayer elevates this game higher, especially now with ETS2 Convoys and especially with mod support in said convoys. 

Don't have many, if any, negatives about this game.

It's a very contemplative experience to drive for 1000+ kilometers through Europe. 
A wheel and pedals are a must for this game. Some parts, such as speed cameras right after signs lowering the speed limit, slow AI drivers, and the AI slamming on the breaks into your face is annoying but manageable. Also a lot of fun to avoid red lights by going the wrong way down the parallell road! 

Overall an 8.5/10: Good atmosphere, relaxing, fun to see your company grow, dumb as bricks AI. A bit of polish or some mods and this would be a 10/10.

I am then reminded of how infuriating the AI can be in this game and uninstall it.

Went into the game expecting to grab a few hours out of it for the meagre ¬£3.79 or so I'd paid for it, to then move on and thinking nothing of it.

Boy, oh boy was I wrong about that.

It takes something that should be boring by design, monotonous even, and makes it enjoyable. It's relaxing, therapeutic, cathartic? There is something genuinely satisfying about kicking back, flipping on the radio, enjoying some music whilst taking in the scenery across a variety of European landscapes on the way to finishing your current job.

As of now, I've completed a bunch of quick jobs, built up some safety capital to take a loan and then used that loan to purchase my first truck. I'm steadily paying that off whilst exploring and completing jobs, along with upgrading my truck and customising it with the spare change in my pocket. I've only really scratched the surface at the moment and I'm yet to own multiple garages, trucks or a driver / staff network, but I'm looking forward to that down the line.

Ultimately, the game-play loop won't change much, but it doesn't need to as it does what it intends to do quite well and I'm having a good time with it.

Happy I decided to take the plunge on something I wasn't sure of, ended up really enjoying this one.

Best simulator you'll find. Genuinely. Don't go in expecting some amazing exciting blood-pumping gameplay. This is a game you pick to calm down or when you simply don't know what else to play. Once you get the hang of the basics, this game will take the ,,guaranteed enjoyment'' spot in your library. If you already bought the game, but you're considering a refund, because you're not getting the enjoyment you thought you would - stop. Give it some more time, it will get better the more you play, and especially the more you explore. In this game driving isn't the main focus - the scenery and those sexy machines are what you'll be mentally jackin' off to. I recommend buying all of the dlcs, but only on sale, because they can go down by up to 80% off, and quite frequently at that. The dlcs have 10 times more detail and content than the base game, but that's a given considering the basic map came out in 2012, and the skill of the developers grew since then. I bought a steering wheel just for this game, which I'd never have thought I'd do back when I initially bought the game - that's how hooked you will be. I hit my 100th hour, playing with a steering wheel in VR (It is supported without mods). When I took of the headset I felt like I just came back home from a genuine trip across Europe. I honestly do not know what else I am supposed to add. Just buy the game and give it as many chances as you can possibly hand out. If you buy the game on sale, don't even bother refunding it, you'll be happy you didn't.

American Truck Simulator and Euro Truck Simulator 2 are both great games. I bought the games a few years back when they were on sale for $4.99. I absolutely love this game. With all the new DLC's coming out theres so much more to explore. You also have TruckersMP and Promods to make the game more fun. You can also mod the game (not compatible with TruckersMP) to make it even more beautiful or fun. There are all kinds of mods, visual, audio, AI, map, you name it!

The trucks, physics and graphics however, are amazing. It feels realistic. With mods you can make the game even better and they're super easy to install. If you need money or you're not a high enough level for a truck you like, you can either mod your level/money or you 'grind' for it.

9/10
Although this game is already 9 years old, it still has pretty nice graphics, and is pretty unique. Gameplay is very interesting and entertaining (mainly online thanks to mods and with a wheel setup), it's sometimes pretty fun with friends,, sometimes a bit raging with people crashing into people and creating a big mess, with also some glitches (you can make infinite money with a mod content bug), some bugs (the game sometimes gives you a fine because you "passed the intersection at red light" as it was at orange light) but nothing really annoying, except when your truck clips through texture because of accidents. Some people will bore on this game really fast, some others will not, but that's an interesting experience, with a pretty "simulation-like" driving experience (you have blinkers, your truck can stall, you have cruise control which is very rare in car/truck games).

A fucking game is mining crypto on your GPU or something. Fucking no-sense usage of your GPU power even in main menu afk in alt+tab is 99%. WTF. I don't want my sole-one video card to die because of a game where there is no real high-end graphics, but it just kills your GPU for no reason. 

The game content is overall ok though

UPD: Well, it was fixed by manually turning v-sync in Nvidia Control panel. Found a "fix" there: (https://steamcommunity.com/app/227300/discussions/0/3094509155609467740/). 
IT probably had to deal with some unlimited FPS. An engine infinitely required the CPU to calculate as much as possible. 
Probably locking the FPS to the frequency of the monitor is recommended as well.
 
There is a problem that wasn't fixed, despite the game having 10 years of experience, and a quite a community: a shame, really. And please, don't even start on "that's TOTALLY NORMAL" thing as a lot of normies were telling on similar threads. Cause it's obviously not. The game doesn't need that much of a GPU power to run smoothly. That much of GPU usage lead some "users" to bust their GPU's much much faster. Which is not really good thing, considering the time we live in... 

In conclusion: I leave the review as negative until the game run smoothly on default settings, without any unnecessary computing, as intended. The game itself, however: is to my very liking. Hope the devs will think and fix that issue, it would be really nice.

Nice game. It was a bit hard to setup and fix the VR mode, and now it's FINALLY working. VR in this one is far from perfect, but does the job quite well. On the Quest 2 stuff beyond ~10 meters away are VERY blurry, but you can drive ok. The only downpoint is performance: I have a, RTX 3070 ti, and the game STILL (since almost 1 decade ago) has lots of rubberbanding, stutter, and other performance and bug problems. DEVS, WHEN WILL YOU FIX IT ALL?! Dear lord... Since 2012 pointing this all out! Nothing gets fixed! Each passing year, more and more problems need fixing... 

I like the way trucks work, and as I have even worked in a truck factory, I can say they're quite accurate! Really cool. I just wish sounds were more close to each individual truck, and more interactions were possible. 

But sadly, to trully get the entire game, you need to buy WAY too much in DLCs... This is the sad part. I DON'T like the way they charge for pieces of the map and addons. The base game is so cheap it should be named "base game demo", or even get released for free (again, 10 YEARS), and then you pay for DLC if you want. That'd be nicer! 
When you're missing TOO MUCH if you don't get most DLCs, this is the problem: it's not clearly explained when you get the base game, and this makes me REALLY disappointed. New players get totally confused. 

Final veredict: 6/10 for base game, too restricted, could be a 7 if some of the new trucks, parts or addons from some of the DLCs were added for it at no cost, otherwise feels like selling the same game for almost a decade while not adding much on it. Not buying many DLCs means not getting much different from 2012. Again.. ALMOST TEN YEARS SINCE RELEASE. 

DEVs 100% need to stop wasting time with their restrictive old slow bad performing engine and start a new better game ASAP, based on a more capable mainstream engine. They know how to code! But that ain't making it easier when using new technologies. Just imagine if the game had better performance and compatibility for DLSS and RT! 
Many other games have more details, more simulation and better graphics and have BETTER PERFORMANCE. 
I really like simulation games, but I won't and shouldn't wait 10 more years for the next great better one because the devs keep waisting time with stupid tons of generic little DLCs. Time better spent making the game run better and have better graphics. It's DX11 based and still don't got 10% of the graphics settings many other games have. I'm that frustrated because I feel the potential this game has and could be an even better ETS3 instead.

I started with American Truck Simulator first, and I have over 155 hours logged in on that game so far, but its big brother Euro Truck Simulator 2 has been a slow burn for me. Now that I'm establishing myself on ES2, I am seeing the benefits of a Euro setting to my truck driving adventures. This game rocks! It is a wonderful representation of "that road life" and the European aspect of it really sets it apart from its American Truck Simulator counterpart. Graphics, audio, etc. are similar if not identical. Great casual gaming all around. Sales are common, so if you see it at full price then just give it a few weeks. SCS is always offering sales on Steam so just hang in there if you are interested but not sure about the full price scheme.

Been playing ETS2 since 2012, I'll break it down into simple pro's, con's & wishes.

Pro's:
- Immense map (though the best bits are DLC related maps)
- The map gets updates; both in terms of new locations and old locations receiving updates
- Detailed trucks & trailers
- Fantastic customization (though some of it locked behind DLC)
- Being able to copy a configuration so expanding your fleet with the same trucks becomes easier
- Recently added *official* multiplayer mode
- The game is so relaxing
- DLC is very affordable and includes new countries, cargo, customization, liveries ...

Con's:
- Some might say there's too much DLC in this game (76 items at the time of this review)
- As your company grows, buying new trucks & drivers becomes a chore; would be nice to simply buy 5 trucks at once and auto-hire a driver for em.
- The multiplayer mode; as great as it is, lacks social features. As well as reporting-features; or ignore lists. Sadly toxicity and griefers also can make their way into ETS2
- Sometimes, traffic feels weird, no traffic jams ever, unless the Ai messes up unto itself.

Wishes:
- More licensed trailers for more industries (Nooteboom, Schmitz ... MORE)
- Visual update on older truck models
- New Lights & Beacons (dlc?)
- A slide-bar that allows us to change traffic density
- Dirty trucks / Flat tires / Oil changes etc. Extra maintanance for realism
- Being able to design our own trailer-livery with an in-game editor. Not everyone likes mods. Adding 'company information' on trucks would fit as well. 
- Allowing for owned trailers to be passed around automatically between garages, so you just buy trailers for the whole company, not 1 specific location.

When I first bought this game, boy did I love it, I mean really love playing it. I grew up around trucks, what with my father owning a haulage company. So it was a delight to see a Volvo F10 in the workshop and actually be able to drive one of the trucks my old man owned. That really appealed to me, so much so I taught myself how to mod a trailer, make a skin for the truck. Then life got in the way, my father got ill and I wasn't able to play ETS2 for over 18 months. I came back a few months ago, hoping to play it and take the old truck out on the road. But ETS2 had other idea's, Steam forced me to update my install, even though I didn't want to (Would have been nice to have the option). The update completely messed up my install and made all my mods, custom skins incompatible. Basically it broke a previously perfectly working game. Way to go SCS Software! Truly, bravo! There should be an option to opt out of updates, because you know what your update did? It put me off buying anything more from SCS software. I'm done constantly having to wonder if the next time I play the game, you'll have broke something else I like.

So long as you don't use any mods, alter your game in anyway, you'll probably have a great time playing ETS2. IMHO SCS should remove the mod feature from the game as it leads one to think ETS2 is a mod friendly game.

I've played this game since very close to release and I've also played most of the older trucking games that SCS has made. To me this game is the equivalent of comfort food.

Yes, it's nice for killing time, it's also nice for something to do while you're listening to a podcast or chatting with a friend. Sometimes though, you just have to step back and admire the work and soul that's been poured into this. The attention to little details, the pursuit of making the roads and landscapes feel accurate even though the map about 1/19th of the size. Even the lighting effects as your truck passes under a street light late at night, the sounds and of course all the beautifully crafted mods made by one of the most dedicated communities out there.

I could go on for ages, but I think you should get it yourself and discover more of these trinkets on your own.

Very enjoyable and a fresh change from American Truck Simulator for me.  Hard to find anything I don't like about the game.  I did start with a keyboard and found it somewhat difficult as the roads and such are very tight compared to ATS, not a lot of room for error.  I love playing the game now I have a wheel for my computer!  The trucks are super highly detailed and the scenery is great!

What it does well: 
 + Each country is well researched and the landscape looks / feels realistic. Road markings, signs and textures are realistic for each country
 + The graphics are good/great. One of my favorite things is to enjoy the landscape while making deliveries. 
 + Can be a low-stress, very relaxing game. 
 + Really the only option out there currently.

Downsides:
 - No dynamic seasons / seasonal weather - Snow would be really nice. I know there are mods, but...
 - Roads ending suddenly - It would be nice to have a larger road network, including alternate routes that would allow for avoiding tolls
 - Asset loading / unloading - the game will unload assets once you pass them - it's really weird seeing the tunnel you just passed through disappear in your rear view mirror. 
 - Asset variety - As a gearhead i would love to see a larger variety of traffic / car models in the game. 
 - Expensive: If you want access to the entire map, there are a lot of DLC's / Expansions that need to be purchased. 
 - Lag / Stutter. After playing for long periods of time I get rubber banding - The game will slow down, the suddenly speed up to 2-4x speed before returning to normal. A restart normally fixes this
  - More management options for the drivers you can hire would be nice - Assign them to longer routes or specific routes or cargoes.

Overall a good game, but there certainly is room for improvement before I would call it great. With all the DLC's available it does make sense to wait for a sale to pick it all up at once.

What is there to say that hasn't been said about this game before? It's really fantastic. Though the physics are by no means full on racing-sim level, why would you ever need them to be? You're driving a truck along motorways and country roads, not pushing a Porsche 911 GT3 around the Norchliefe to its absolute limits. The physics are more than good enough for what this game is, and with the correct mods from the workshop can feel just as detailed as the likes of Assetto Corsa when driving normally and perhaps a little too quickly!

In addition to this, mod support is really good, with the option to keep the game at a specified version to ensure all of your mods aren't broken in an update. It's called Euro Truck Simulator but with the right mods you can drive in Indonesia, North Africa and South America - just to name a few.

If the images and videos get your interest then I cannot recommend this game enough. It is everything you have seen and quite possibly more.

Hundreds of thousands of kilometers traveled, thousands of liters of oil and tens of hours behind the wheel - all to taste the life of a real "trucker" in Euro Truck Simulator 2. Was it worth it?  It depends.  Euro Truck Simulator 2 is just "only" a good title of this genre.  The production is very playable and enjoyable, but at the same time it disappointed me with some of its solutions - maybe I was just too demanding for it.  However, this does not change the fact that it is currently the best truck simulator available and I can honestly recommend it to every fan of "road cruisers".

As a 61 year old ex-UK trucker with 35 years of experience behind me, I can honestly say this fantastic game is as close as it gets to the real thing!
Great selection of tractor units and trailers and brilliant maps.  Driving physics, sounds and graphics - all better enhanced with the best mods - are spot on!

Get yourself a really good wheel and pedals (I use the G29) and you're good to go - and you don't have the stress of dreadful route planners and transport managers with sh*tty attitudes.

ETS2 has to be possibly the best driving game out there.  It's definitely the king of large vehicle driving games!

This game is surprisingly fun with many roads to drive and beautiful scenery to take in, plus, the trucks are highly detailed and fun to modify and improve. The feeling of getting a new truck is always something to cherish, as you start to build your own collection, you realise you need more garage space to store the trucks and so you complete more deliveries and BAM! You can hire drivers to complete deliveries for you so you can take a break.

Pros:
Fun and doesn't seem to get old (for me it's still fun after 69 hours)
Cheap! For a small game, ¬£15 ($20) is reasonable, but it's often on sale for ¬£4 ($5)!
Many great DLCs! They are inexpensive and are great value for money.
Great Developers! They are constantly updating the game even though it's a decade old now!
Excellent controller support! Keyboard, Gamepad or Sim Wheel, they all work very well!
Mod support done well; Many great mods can easily be implemented into the game!

Cons:
Some areas are tedious to drive through, like most of England's motorways and all the ferry ports' roads.
The DLC vary in quality, and so do the trucks.
Not enough trucks (Mods can fix this).

All in all, it's a great game worth buying!

I cannot emphasize how great this game is!

This review might sound like one of those humorous over the top ones but this has honestly given me so much for what I paid for this game.

I bought it originally as a "I'll get an hour out of it every now and then" game, starting off with a controller. Pretty much straight away... I'm living on this thing, putting hour after hour into it.. 

I'm from the UK.. and with no disrespect to SCS... The default UK map is horrendous.. there's not much authenticity to it... But then I found the modding community... Good god I was amazed at how many mods there are for this game. As soon as I saw promods I downloaded it and within an hour on that, I had a wheel, pedals and gearstick ordered.

This game with a few mods looks immensely realistic... I just sit here for hours at a time sometimes with some earphones in... Sometimes with music and sometimes just listening to the sounds of the environment around me... 

This game has increased my obsession with trucks dramatically and exploring the promods world and seeing some of the landscape has at points Literally had my mouth wide open in amazement. 

Don't get me wrong... This game does have some annoying factors... But they're nothing compared to the positives and if anything just make it realistic. Sometimes the traffic AI make silly decisions like slowing right down on a motorway when other traffic tries to merge onto it... Causing me to either slam into them or have to indicate quickly and knock the next lanes traffic out.  sometimes they fail to give way at roundabouts and I'm blamed for it etc. But I also acknowledge this happens in real life sometimes and by no means puts me off this game. 

I'm completely obsessed and in love with it when using a steering wheel I just forget everything exists... It's just me and Silvia (my truck üòÇüòú). I love this game with a passion and can safely say I'd spend many more hours on it..

This is such a stress reliever and whenever I'm feeling down its a sure fire way of cheering me up a bit by forgetting whatever I'm down about and adding a few thousand miles onto Silvia's clock. 

I 1000% recommend this game and now after getting a new wheel after the old one broke I'm definitely going to be racking the hours up. 

Sidenote - I also have all of the DLC and it's amazing!!

Great game, graphics are most appreciated and the rain effects while driving are good.  I also enjoy the realism of the hauling of certain weights of loads.  Traffic can be annoying and it's a tiny bit hard to not just pedal to the metal everywhere since you have to beware that cars will come out in front of you and stuff while approaching red lights.  There's options to change a lot of the things in game that might not be too good at the first bit and it makes the game really playable.  If you have a USB controller you can configure it with the game to make gameplay much nice.  Lastly I didn't realize for years that this game was available on Linux and I am so amazing stoked that it is.  DLC selection is also very nice too.  Can connect to WorldOfTrucks website and there's a sister game for it called American Truck Simulator in case you don't like the european style of trucks or map.  Absolutely recommend this game to all.

First time I saw ETS2 I thought: Nah not my thing, good friend of mine said try it...then lockdowns kicked in, then the Winter sale put this icing on the cake! what enjoyable little game^^ truckin' about, making deliveries, getting a slapped wrist by rozzers like a noob...ahem; happily, gradually getting used to being in a cab, weight, grip and individuality of each truck, reversing into place to deliver truck and container for the full xp, right hand drive, left hand drive, making trips for UK to Europe and vise-versa...Well worth picking in the sale with all DLC included, easy to play with a controller a smidge remapping helped alot.

Update 16/01/2022: really enjoying ETS2 such a good game, throwin' on some lofi chill drive on youtube, best so far has been going from Strasbourg to Lyon with a slight puckering of the cheeks as I head down unlit country lanes with 50mph limit hauling 21tons of LPG just letting the cruise control do it's thing... odd thing is that it reminds me of/ give that nostalgia feel of Jaguar XJ220 racer on the Mega CD, Lotus Elise and Lotus Elise 2 on the Amiga/Atari ST 520....just pulling several tons of cargo, at 60mph on down hill section of a motorway speed limiter doing it best to slow me down and failing whilst trying not to flip my truck again going round a high speed corner!
I hope this game still update for the future, Or maybe next update DLC indonesian map

Euro Truck Simulator 2; Life is a Motorway?

ETS2, as it is commonly referred to, is a trucking simulator featuring some of the better traffic AI I have ever seen, in which; they're all pricks. The game itself involves a player slowly building up their own trucking empire, starting by using company trucks and trailers, to their own trucks, to eventually, their own trailers. The game developer as foreseen the issue on spending a literal 7 hours on the road, and as such, has a clever time skip, that simulates time quicker while driving which games gameplay enjoyable.

My main issue with this game, is the cities and the photos of them, against what is posted as well as a severe lack of detail. Picture this, you've completed a long drive starting from Paris, your destination is London. You're carrying a large crate of wood shavings (Don't ask me why) and need to get across the channel. There are two methods, either hop on a train, or hop on a ferry. No Eurotunnel to drive through; first disappointment. Next, once you finally reach your method of transportation, you're greeted with a menu. "Fast Travel to Dover?" Of course, you must click, am I then given a cool montage of the sailing progress or the train going through the tunnel? No, my screen fades to black, the game loads, then I appear on a new Ferry in Dover, ready to drive off and go. Following a disappointing channel crossing, I finally make it to London. I see the Gherkin form on the horizon, with the London Eye and a few other similar buildings of the London skyline. But wait, it's just in the background, a skybox. The London itself, that you can drive on, is no larger than a small Russian city on the other side of the continent. What a buzzkill huh?

Don't get me wrong, fun to drive, if tedious at times, and certainly relaxing, but more than a few things that make me go, 'seriously'? I expected a lot more from a larger developer, especially as this game was a sequel.

And what about the cultural impact, you might ask? Well, governments have agreed to withdraw nuclear arms race just to be able to play some EURO TRUCK SIMULATOR 2, kids in school no longer study Fortnite skins, and they have EURO TRUCK SIMULATOR 2 to thank for that.

I love EURO TRUCK SIMULATOR 2, I play EURO TRUCK SIMULATOR 2, I breathe EURO TRUCK SIMULATOR 2, because I want to be EURO TRUCK SIMULATOR 2. Your boyfriend, your dead grandmother, and even your local game journalist can enjoy this piece of history and masterpiece. 5/5

Euro truck simulator 2 (ETS2)
The ultimate truck driving simulator

ETS2 is a truck driving game, based on the older truck sim . As its name suggests you are driving in Europe.

Location:
As the base game  you can drive in the Northeast of France, south of the UK, Luxembourg, Germany, Netherlands and Belgium.

Trucks:
As of trucks you get pretty good choices of the more modern trucks. But if you want to you can add mods. Truck dealers are MAN, Volvo, Iveco, Renault, Mercedes and Scania. Most of the community recommends Scania or Mercedes.

Settings:
The settings are great in my opinion. You can costumize almost everything. ETS2 supports steering wheels. But you can also srive with a keyboard or controller.

DLC:
The biggest drawback in ETS2 is that for almost anything you want to add to the game you need to buy DLCs. We now to groups of DLCs. 1. Map extensions, 2. Tunning extensions. Map extensions are priced around 19.99‚Ç¨. Tunning extensions go for 10‚Ç¨. The older DLCs get bigger discount's while newer smaller ones.

Conclusion:
Euro truck simulator 2 is an great game. And the developers are doing a great job at updating and making DLCs. With a few drawbacks, like the pricing of the DLCs. The game receives a 9.5/10.

First of all I want to say that I'm playing this game since 2021.

This is a game certainly worth spending the money for. That is easy ... all elements you'll find in a real life trucker's life, you'll find in the game. You can make the gameplay as easy as you want but also as hard as you want. And then I'm talking about the controls which you can choose to put on all automatic or trying to do everything yourself by deactivating that automatic stuff. The more you challenge yourself as being a virtual truck driver the more interesting this game gets! Aside from that the graphics are marvelous which means you can really enjoy every little detail on the trucks and - not to forget - the environment.

If you want to take it a little bit further than just the game itself you can go for the truckersmp multiplayer modification which is free to get and use! This will provide you the chance to drive with your friends in a huge multiplayer environment. And from that you can even take it a bit more advanced by joining a VTC (Virtual Trucking Company).

As you can see the developers of both the game itself and the multiplayer environment are providing us with more than enough material to keep you busy for the rest of your gaming days!

Euro Truck Simulator 2 is that rare thing, a strong sim tethered to a strong game. Where other vehicle-obsessed devs seem to take player motivation for granted, Czech studio SCS understand that a pleasingly modelled steed needs a pleasingly modelled environment to shine. On this occasion that environment is a swathe of Europe stretching from Plymouth in the west to Wroclaw in the east, from Aberdeen in the north to Milan in the South. The tangle of motorways and major roads is stylised and condensed, but feels massive.

TLDR: if you like the demo you will love the game; try the demo.

First off, I played the demo, before purchasing the game, which I would recommend to anyone interested in this game rather than watching YouTube videos of people with ¬£4000 computers with steering wheels.

Second, I also use an Xbox controller to play the game only using the keyboard for certain things like loading the game up and adjusting settings.  The game can be played exclusively with a controller and is a cheaper alternative to an expensive steering wheel; also the rumble effect works too which helps.

Would I recommend this game?  If you liked the demo then obviously yes I would as the demo is a 3 hour timed version of the game; not sure if it is the actual retail version or just the demo version, but I do think the retail version looks and runs better.

The game is fun and enjoyable and the included radio stations are amazing; lots to enjoy there.  The graphics are good (for a game like this, much better than Farming Sim games) and the driving mechanics are excellent and enjoyable.

I only use a few mods which are easy to install from the game's mod-menu and only include minor changes as there is very little that needs changing.  

If people are concerned about mods outside of the steamworkshop I would say they are not necessary as the map booster pack (which is what I recommend https://store.steampowered.com/bundle/5555/Euro_Truck_Simulator_2_Map_Booster/) is enough to start and gives you a lot of places to visit.

Thank you to SCS Software for making such a good game and I look forward to future updates (and hopefully a next-gen console version!!!!!)  please!!.

Hi Team,

I have been playing this game since 8 Years. in these years there are lot of changes has been done. I am pretty excited about that. Very Nice one in Simulation segment. Here I mentioned likes & Dislikes

Likes:
1. Impressive trucks & Trailers.
2. Roads & Weather simulation is cool.
3. Real time experience and fun, relaxing 
4. Cities and Game design improved a lot.
5. Introduced new Maps, roads & traffic

Dislikes:
1. Needs to improve vehicle features.
for example the highest engine capacity of scania V8 770 HP) not in the list.
2. Poor Breaking sensitivity for every truck
3. No off roads
4. Vehicle lighting system not better than American truck simulator
5. Improve motion bar effects
6. Need to add some more trucks
7. Cars and other vehicles not that much expectations reached.
8. Snow weather couldn't see in the game mods
9. Need add reverse parking camera.

Good relaxing game, but I wouldn't recommend the DLC as you spend a lot of the time driving round in pitch black darkness, so you wouldn't get to see much of the scenery. Plus if your a safe driver your eyes are looking forward at the road anyway. Just get the base game.
Driving on the road while listening to the radio, just what I needed
Driving around in virtual Europe while listening to the radio or a good podcast is a surprisingly enjoyable and relaxing experience. An acquired taste, perhaps, but still a good game.

The most important thing to note about this game is that the folks from the company take special care.
If you're into a very chill game and likes the slight idea of working on freights and sightseeing, this game represents it with the best of its capacity.

It's 9 years old and still strong. That is basically all you need to know.

It has a lot of trucks, most of the Europe by now, they are regualrly updating legasy locations and the engine itself.

Whlile I might want a direct access to configuration files to set LOD/shadow distances and somtimes angry at blind AI, I spent almost 500 hours in the game and it got me througth a lot, when I needed to a safe space to be with myself and think or just relaxt after a hard day.

[h1] This is the best simulator on the market [/h1]

I played with some other simulators like OMSI, Bus Simulator, etc. but none of those satisfied my needs for a driving simulator. Then I met ETS2...
Do you have enough of the russian screaming kids in CSGO, or the guys in Rocket League who admittedly banged your mom last night? Well, well, this is your game then! No madness, just chill driving with beautiful landscapes!

This game constantly gets improvements, and has so many cool DLCs that you'll probably find whatever pleases you.

I  HIGHLY RECOMMEND this game. Really. 

And finally, a list of improvements I'd like to see in the future. I will come back and check anything that's been added.

    - I'd like to have winter and snow in the game. Would be fun to drive in different conditions.
    - I'd like to see animals and other hazards on the roads which would also make the driving more versatile.

Game is fun and the world is very beautiful. However, do not try doing online contracts. Every time I try to do an online World of Trucks External Contract, I will drive, deliver the load and be hit with a message box, "Synchronizing your progress with World of Trucks". About 25% of the time it will go through and the assignment will complete. The other 75% of the time it will hang. No matter how long I wait for it to process (I waited once over an hour) it will not sync up, so I have to hit cancel and restart the game to resync with World of Trucks. However, doing that sets me back usually 300km away from my destination. So I have to drive another 300km, THAT I'VE ALREADY DRIVEN, just to back my trailer in AGAIN, to complete the contract. This translates to another 15 minutes real time I have to redo what I've already done because SCS's servers cannot connect for whatever reason. It is not my internet connection either. I've done all the troubleshooting I can and every 'solution' proffered has not solved this issue.

It is extremely aggravating to spend an hour and a half on a contract just to redo the last 15-20 minutes because World of Trucks cannot connect. So if you're wanting to truck offline, fun game. But if you're wanting to partake in the online community events, plan on adding an extra 300km to your drive and having to park the trailer in twice.

Edit: I am playing a clean install. No Mods, just the official DLC.

Amazing game, worthy of overwhelmingly positive status. All of the mechanics and visuals work flawlessly to create an engaging experience. Even though this is a simulator, it can be as hardcore or casual as you like depending on your gameplay settings. You do not need to be interested in trucks to enjoy the game. Sit back, relax, and enjoy.

The fines are a frikin problem, get a red light while still turning? you get a fine for that. Got a car ramming into you at high speed?(while turning at a junction or just driving normally) there's a fine for that. Too bored or thought that your too rich? get a random fine for crashing in to a car for no reason. Yes i got fined for nothing the closest car was like miles in front of me there was no car in the near vicinity other than the ones i'm carrying but getting a fine for what crashing a non-existent car? and lastly my speed was just at the limit of 80 but suddenly its maximum speed limit dropped from 80 to 50? well bad luck you get fined for that like really? I know there's a police car beside me but he was speeding too so was the other cars and that truck behind me why am i getting charged for that! Its like the NPCs are making me go bankrupt when I'm already having a hard time keeping to schedule to deliver fragile like trailers that can break with a light scratch on time while earning almost nothing if that's what you devs planed then wow you people need help(like from professionals who knows more about truck driving and laws and just everything about trucks and everything about real world physics and i dunno roads? objects on the roads?). after 3 hrs+ of game play i can say the game was fine but the fines... it needs a lot of working on especially those darn NPCs, cause only the player in this world gets fined and you know it. So I as an individual or maybe others is asking for an update on those problems like please change it so that I don't keep losing my money to ramming cars and accidentally running a red light while speeding at 80 since the GPS just never tell you about anything and told you to turn in which straits in to a red light...and got a fine .___. it was dark and night time so i was darn pissed about it. I'm not sure if its just me that's having this problem but I'm sad because these damn things are so common throughout my game play.

A couple of simple questions to ask yourself:

Do you like driving?
Do you like exploring?

Get this game!

No seriously, this game has been the gem of the decade, I've played the first early version in 2012 and it was rough, but it just absolutely matured into a special masterpiece. Every time you log on, you will have a damn good time! I send all my love to the devs, they've put all their passion and faith into this machine (hehe) of a game and they've delivered big time! They've finished off the decade by adding the cherry on top, a freaking multiplayer mode in order to truck with your mates!

A trully complete game 10/10

For devs: Thank you for bringing such a spectacular map of Europe into the digital realm, me and many other have always wanted to explore the world as much as possible in any sort of way and you guys made a lot of it possible, we thank you with the utmost respect! All of us are extremely excited for Heart of Russia to come out, but we ask you to take as much time as you need to polish it up completely, just like with the rest of the game. Love you all!

Oh, and one small suggestion. If you get to that point where you want to start improving the whole map all together by adding more cities, please consider Oradea my home town which is located right next to the Bors border between Hungary and Romania (you probably already know this). The city has transformed into a hidden treasure of Europe in the last decade, exactly like this game!

Pick it up on sale, along with the older DLCs as they're usually at a steep discount. France, Italy, and Scandinavia are excellent starting points in my opinion.

Truck driving simulator with an autistically anal kind of accuracy
Trucks are realistic, scenery and towns? 2014 graphics; not even close.
Rarely crashes and aside from auto-reversing trucks, very few bugs

Controls? Pretty much how children think driving lorries would be like
Not even remotely realistic, even if you turn all the settings on
Roads? They're 10m strips that don't tick off as "unlocked" until driven down

This means driving every way around every junction if you want to complete the game
Handbrake (space) is the best brake - use it everywhere (turn off auto in options)
Stick to quick jobs till 10 NPCs (to cover costs) then buy a truck to explore with

Give NPCs the cheapest Iveco, balance skills (1 all) > long dist to max > balanced
Turn off fines and, when you've learned to slow down for corners, speed limiters
Use Convoy Mode to take rest breaks when you can't afford the time penalties

Simple Parking - Camera 3 to line up after driving close
Skilled Parking - Camera 2 to reverse, face the cab, left to move the back end left

Best for Exploring? Basic Scania + 6x2/4 + 730HP + 6 Speed Gearbox
Best for Trucking? Basic Scania + 8x4/4 + 730HP + 12 Speed Gearbox
Truck & Trailer "upgrades" are cosmetic only and increase your repair costs

Interest calculates daily in game and there's no early repayment fees
Max loans out at the start and invest early to build your empire

6/10 - About as fun as mowing the lawn if your garden was the size of europe

Issues: 

Seems to have some passive racism though as all drivers on the roads are white
Quick Job Truck damage costs nothing to repair and Trailer damage is meaningless
Employers don't care about crashes and Ratings are pointless

I can't state in mere words how much I've grown to love this silly truck game.

1370+ hours in and I'm not regretting one singular second of playing this game.
I'm coming clean here: I love driving. I love travelling. This game combines both and adds to this a 1:19 (with the UK a little larger at 1:15) scale Europe that manages to be at the same time both quirky and highly realistic considering the limiting scale. You see little landmarks in the skyline of a city, or along the road, or pass a major bridge which you might recognise if you've ever driven around Europe. I've visited many of the cities that are represented in this game's world in real life, and I must say that especially the newer-released ones - the ones in the recent DLCs - really are spot-on. The liminality of travel is there and if you're into roadtrips you'll definitely love this game, even if you've got nothing for trucks (beware, it WILL grow on you eventually). Be ready for some driving time though because every 19 km travelled in-game equals one real km travelled on the in-game map, and this adds up on longer journeys from one end of the map to another - trips can take several IRL hours at its most extreme because of this!

There are still some areas that haven't much changed since the game originally released (2012) but those are slowly getting revamped bit by bit. I've not seen any other developer still caring so much about a game this popular nine years after an initial base game release. There's still DLC getting released plus the main game, and even existing DLC also get free content updates on a fairly regular basis. Speaking of this, the trucks themselves are pretty great vehicles, all of them licensed and highly detailed, plus there's loads of customization options you can choose from - especially if you've bought the Cabin Accessories DLC (which I highly recommend buying with the base game!). Driving physics are top-notch, and I've never seen a driving sim this realistic yet still this accessible - you can choose from multiple control schemes from simple to highly complex, making this game even accesible to the most casual of gamers (or even those with no IRL driving license and no clue how to drive ;P). Recently the game also added a co-op mode called 'Convoy', which should by the time I'm writing this also have support for mods.

The map DLCs are pretty much essential imho if you want to get a variety of diverse and good-looking places to go - the newer the DLC the better the quality is a good rule of thumb. The question of buying the other DLCs (paintjobs, new cargoes, tuning parts) is more of a matter of personal taste, and I with my poor judgement shouldn't say too much on those I think ;P.

Graphics-wise it should run pretty good on mid-range PCs - I've even played it modded on a laptop earlier with little issue. If you're using lots of mods though the game is demanding on your GPU - I've maxxed out mine whilst playing with lots of mods more than once. At it's best the game is really great-looking though, it's possible in places to take screenshots that could easily be mistaken for actual photographs ;P.

If you're trying to get any serious driving done in this game, then definitely use some of the excellent map mods around. They enhance the experience even further, you get new areas, you get rebuilds of existing areas that the game's developers haven't yet come around to - in many cases I've found these to be even more enjoyable and realistic than the vanilla map areas. I've been to places as diverse as Kazakhstan, Egypt or Svalbard using map mods. Be prepared though to spend a lot of your time behind the wheel and you better have a good graphics card and like an extra 30 free GB of storage for the mod files if you're using them all at once ;P.

Overall this has been a nothing but a great experience. I've played this game regularly since 2014 and I still periodically return to it for new adventures on the road (could you imagine?). If you're into relaxing driving in any way, shape or form, play this game. It is worth every penny you'll put into it.
